page.title: 06Farming (Land Use)
page.content: The main land use is permanent pasture used for both beef and cattle and also for winter feed of both hay and silage. Much of the land is near to, or even below sea level, and consequently in the winter months most of the cattle have to be housed in the farm buildings. This land has to be constantly drained and this drainage is closely monitored because flooding in such an area as this could be disasterous. However, in winter it is sometimes deliberately flooded to relieve the pressure of water on the nearby rivers and water channels. Much of the higher ground is given over to arable farming, the main crops being potatoes, wheat and barley. There are occasional sundry crops of oats, maize for silage, fodder beet and other root vegetables.
